p: This strategy was applied to conserved and differential spots in each culture ( S1â€“ S5 Tables). Additionally, a theoretical two-dimensional gel was built with IP and MW values as plane coordinates of the spots in the cultures that matched T. solium secretome. As expected, a greater number of proteins matching the secretome were found in low-MW regions (< 20 kDa) ( S1 Fig). In addition, a protein interaction map was created to predict the segregation of spots. As shown in Fig 4, one protein was conserved in all cultures in the interaction map, while 14 proteins were conserved in four of the five cultures ( Fig 4).
